blog.name: strangemischief
blog.title: What Strange Trickery This Is
blog.description: Ironstrange + Supremefamily | Occasional Thor or Loki Content | Side Blog | Tag List | Ao3

question: Wolf AU? (Everyone's a wolf)
answer:
I wasn’t sure if you meant werewolves or like…pack wolves? So, I just did werewolves since I had more ideas for that xD Also not everyone is a wolf, sorry.

1. A small, select, group of the world’s population have the mutation. The afflicted, they call them. There isn’t much known about it. And as is often true for the unknown, a cloud of fear and anger circled around them. Some cultures embrace them. Other’s reject them. In some places they’re hunted down, their corpses dangling high like for all to see, not too unlike trophies. Elsewhere, their faces are smothered in blush and eyeshadow, and their bodies are draped in gold so they can be sold as prizes, treasures, to the highest bidder. But no matter where one of the plagued lived, there was one self-imposed rule that stayed the same… 

…never draw attention. 

2. Concealing one’s true nature made for a lonely, isolated, life, but Stephen had fared well thus far. His town in Nebraska was still…traditional, to say the least. And, perhaps, that was beneficial in the long run. Years of keeping his head down, ears perked, and legs tense and ready to run paid off. He had made it into med school despite having to check off a box indicating he was afflicted because “You’re so tame!” He’d gotten a job at a decent hospital despite the large, inky black ‘A’ stamped on his file since, “No one would ever be able to tell.” He found a landlord not too far from work that rented to people like him as long as, “They control themselves as you do.” 

It’s nice, far nicer than anything Stephen imagined for himself. He works his way through grunt work, keeps his head down, ears perked, and legs tense and ready to run until, finally, he earns his place in the surgical department as the Afflicted Surgeon. The world swoons, thinking Stephen so brave to spend his days letting the blood of the afflicted run over his hands. How valiant he is to risk exposure to the mutation so that another may continue living. 

And then Tony Stark needed a consult after blasting himself into a wall and giving himself a grade two concussion. And he requested Stephen because “He’s the best.” 

3. Tony Stark was loud, defiant, and openly charming as he strutted around the world flashing his shiny, white teeth. He feared no one and nothing. He went wherever he wanted. He did whatever he pleased. Even now, with Stephen attempting to peer into his dark eyes and check his pupils, Tony winked flirtatiously and asked where Stephen liked to go out for drinks. 

Tony Stark who was the exact opposite of everything an afflicted should be, which was, Stephen realized, his instincts rearing at the presence of another wolf, the perfect way to cover the fact that he was. 

4. Stephen was intrigued. Tony was, in a nearly literal sense, a wolf in sheep’s clothing, and he needed to know more. So, once Tony was discharged, they went out for drinks. It was, grudging as Stephen was to admit it and inflate Tony’s ego, enjoyable. So, they went out again, this time to dinner. And again. And again. They went home together. They went to a movie. The spent the moon together, waking up to sunrise, their nude bodies intertwined. Stephen kept his head up, always keen to catch Tony’s gaze. He let himself grow deaf to the outside world, entirely captivated by the melody that was Tony’s voice. His legs relaxed, all his cares swept away as he let himself sink into love’s warm embrace. 

That was a mistake. 

5. Tony Stark, genius billionaire, and Stephen Strange, mysterious Afflicted Surgeon were seen at a restaurant. They arrived together at a party. They disappeared, together, for days at a time, and returned looking worn with dark circles under their eyes. People noticed. People wondered. The scrutiny began. 

The rule was broken. And, when photos of the couple eating lunch at a café, barely visible twin marks marring their necks, the world was unforgiving.

Send me an AU and I’ll write 5 headcanons.
answer_abstract: I wasn’t sure if you meant werewolves or like…pack wolves? So, I just did werewolves since I had more ideas for that xD Also not everyone is a wolf, sorry.

title: Always yours
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2EHGLpa

by bigstarkenergy

Getting kidnapped is normal for them, at this point. But there’s nothing normal about this.

And suddenly, Tony has a choice to make.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Wake Turbulence
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2XQ0xaL

by antigrav_vector

Tony and Bucky go out on a date, make the tabloids, and wind up in bed together, though all that they do is sleep. Peggy approves. So does FRIDAY. Three weeks later, the Winter Soldier makes another appearance, and no one reacts very well to it. Then Pepper and Rhodey arrive, and Tony – despite knowing that everything is about to go completely off the rails before it gets better – finds that comforting and a relief.

Words: 8102, Chapters: 2/3, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (2012), Iron Man (MCU), Captain America (MCU), Marvel, Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Tony Stark, James “Bucky” Barnes, Steve Rogers, Margaret “Peggy” Carter, Virginia “Pepper” Potts, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, mention of various Howling Commandos and Avengers team members
  • Relationships: Tony Stark/James “Bucky” Barnes, Steve Rogers / Margaret “Peggy” Carter, one-sided hinted Winter Soldier/Tony Stark, James “Rhodey” Rhodes/Carol Danvers
  • Additional Tags: post-AoU, pre-CA:CW, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Alternate Universe - Time Travel, Lots of Tony Feels, Tony POV, The Author Regrets Nothing, Fix-It, Time Travel Fix-It, BAMF Peggy Carter, Bucky Barnes & Peggy Carter Friendship, Peggy Carter Lives, Aunt Peggy Carter, James “Rhodey” Rhodes is a Good Bro, Protective James “Rhodey” Rhodes, James “Rhodey” Rhodes & Tony Stark Friendship, Virginia “Pepper” Potts & Tony Stark Friendship, Protective Virginia “Pepper” Potts, Memory Issues, Recovering winter soldier, Crack Treated Seriously


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2XQ0xaL

by antigrav_vector

Tony and Bucky go out on a date, make the tabloids, and wind up in bed together, though all that they do is sleep. Peggy approves. So does FRIDAY. Three weeks later, the Winter Soldier makes another appearance, and no one reacts very well to it. Then Pepper and Rhodey arrive, and Tony – despite knowing that everything is about to go completely off the rails before it gets better – finds that comforting and a relief.

summary: ≡ TONY STARK || FC: ROBERT DOWNEY JR. → “Everything I’ve done, everything I’ll do today, everything I’ll ever do, I do to...
caption:
≡ TONY STARK || FC: ROBERT DOWNEY JR.

→ “Everything I’ve done, everything I’ll do today, everything I’ll ever do, I do to protect this world.”

≡ BIO

Born in the 1970s into the affluent Stark family, Tony was a child prodigy with a fiercely heightened intellect. “Limitations” is a word that doesn’t feature in his lexicon, years at boarding school and enrolling at MIT at the age of 15 to graduate summa cum laude conclusively illustrating his tenacious veracity for knowledge. While close with his mother Maria, his relationship with his father Howard was predominantly strained, a great deal of distance growing between the two as the years went by. But his world came crumbling down when his parents were involved in a car accident in December 1991, an incident which would later be discovered as a staged assassination by HYDRA at the hands of the Winter Soldier. Stark Industries was left in turmoil and Obadiah Stane was left to pick up the pieces. Though successful in the eyes of Forbes and Wall Street, the company fell under dark and uncertain times, even as “the prodigal son” finally took an active interest and became CEO. Creating a series of industry defining designs, Tony’s leadership saw the business’s shares skyrocketing, their notoriety for being technological pioneers preceding them as they attained military funding to provide the US with weapons for use in hostile territories overseas.

During a demo of the billionaire’s latest feat of engineering, the Jericho Missile, in Afghanistan, his privileged lifestyle fell under threat. Captured by the Ten Rings and wounded by shrapnel from his own weapon, the terrorist cell demanded he make a replica of the missile in order to ensure his freedom or die by their hand. Knowing his captors would never keep up their end of the bargain, Tony created an armored suit powered by an arc reactor with the help of Ho Yinsen. After three months of work, they enacted their escape plan. While Yinsen didn’t survive, his message stayed with Tony: don’t waste your life. Tony overhauled his business strategy - adopting more diverse directions in innovation, ceasing all development in weapons, and utilizing repulsor technology to bring about patented Clean Energy across the world.

Tony went on to become a founding member of the Avengers. The Chitauri Invasion that brought them together as a team, also left Tony deeply unsettled. The prospect of Earth being so vulnerable left him striving to protect it no matter how unorthodox his methods. The peace his efforts gained was short-lived, the Avengers’ efforts to secure the cosmic safety of Earth from the threat of Thanos left them vulnerable for Skrulls to infiltrate. Veranke’s forces replaced key figures in society with their own foot soldiers, including Steve Rogers. The Skrull who took his place, Pitt'o, was captured and interrogated by Bucky Barnes. When Tony covertly rendezvoused with the pair, Pitt'o activated a virus which affected the digital signature of the billionaire’s arc reactor. The infiltration of the device left Tony increasingly sick and taken into the care of S.H.I.E.L.D. due to the virus’ corruption spreading across the entirety of the Stark Network, affecting international communications and security. Unable to be at the forefront of the fight against the extraterrestrials, Stark helped behind the scenes, but the plight took a heavy impact on Stark Industries reputation and even moreso on Tony’s sense of well-being.

With the Skrulls defeated, the Network was back online with advanced security measures in place. In a bid to rebuild its ranking in the world, Stark Industries announced the Starkdynamics event in Tokyo, an international think-tank comprising of a global consortium of brilliant people developing paradigm shifting concepts. While several companies showcased their work and research, Tony delivered a keynote speech announcing Project Epsilon, an effort that marked the procurement of Extremis, a carefully crafted virus which harnessed the bioelectrical potential to hack and upgrade the human repair center. Extremis offered the prospect of accelerated healing, boosted immune systems, and organ regeneration. Tony’s personal goal for the project was to heal himself of the shrapnel injuries he had sustained in Afghanistan that made him dependent upon his arc reactor technology. Harry Osborn - in a similar vein - saw the potential for Extremis to cure his inherited, terminal disease. Osborn approached the Avenger with the offer of collaboration. Despite tensions, the two came to an agreement and selected the best minds they knew to aid them in their research, the team making a breakthrough.

With newfound single-minded focus on his work, Tony discovered Oscorp files of questionable content, including connections to the Ravencroft Institute’s dabblings in human experimentation and schematics on patented Stark Industries technology. The discovery brought about a full breakdown of communication between the two CEOs as Tony began shutting Osborn out. In the following weeks, he staged a hackathon, hiring Yelena Belova to retrieve the Extremis sample from Oscorp’s Brooklyn lab. The young CEO’s health rapidly deteriorated with the strain of events, ushering in the Green Goblin who carried out several attacks against Stark Industries’ facilities, leaving almost a hundred casualties in their wake. During an attack at Avengers Mansion, the two clashed and Stark was left severely wounded, his arc reactor destroyed, and - if not for the assistance of Loki, who had his own grudges against the Goblin - left for dead.

Delivered to the Baxter Building and with Extremis administered, Tony learned the Goblin’s true identity. The two enhanced corporate moguls battled it out over Manhattan, ending in a destructive stalemate over the East River, both participants plunging into the depths below as lower Manhattan was thrown into darkness at the hands of an explosive EMP burst set off by the Goblin in one final act of vengeance. The faithful A.I., J.A.R.V.I.S., aided its creator at the conclusion of the dire situation, piloting the Iron Man suit to a safe location as New York City began to recover from the disastrous outcome of the brawl. The United Nations World Security Council resolved to take necessary action to counter the rising tide of an increasingly unaccountable enhanced vigilante community. With immense pressure placed upon S.H.I.E.L.D. to direct the momentum of such a measure, the Agreement Concerning Cooperation, Oversight and Registration of Discovered Superhumans (Accords) were soon subject to a first draft. Stark was the first Avenger to view it, and - in the aftermath of Extremis - became its first supporter based on his sheer guilt for the damage caused to the city, including of the death of one of S.H.I.E.L.D.’s young pilots.

While the Avengers met amongst themselves to discuss their course of action only to find themselves on opposite sides of a fence, Tony became increasingly involved in the support of the Accords. Stark Industries provided stringent protocols required for the database of registrants and Tony became the public face of registration. During a gesture of good will, the World Security Council offered a ceremonial signing of the Accords on S.H.I.E.L.D.‘s Iliad Helicarrier to Steve Rogers and Bucky Barnes. With inside string-pulling from HYDRA, the public was led to believe that the bureaucratic olive branch spiraled into a terrorist attack as the Helicarrier crashed into Liberty Island. Both Barnes and Rogers were implicated in the attack and forced underground. The event was enough to sway public opinion and registration became mandatory for all enhanced individuals, the billionaire tasked with finding the pair.

≡ CURRENTLY

As events unfolded, it was found that individuals detained at the Hart Island Facility were subjected to less than humane conditions and Tony’s opinion shifting to aid his fellow teammates during this desperate time. The Avengers disbanded shortly after the light shone on Hart Island unveiled its ugly truths. Tensions still strain high between the heroes as they aspire to return to their days of glory.

≡ NOTE

FightAsOne has Thor Odinson, Clint Barton, Carol Danvers, Bucky Barnes, and other various characters associated with Tony Stark.

                       → HOW TO JOIN → FAQ → RULES → MOST WANTED

Unable to be at the forefront of the fight against the extraterrestrials, Stark helped behind the scenes, but the plight took a heavy impact on Stark Industries reputation and even moreso on Tony’s sense of well-being.

With the Skrulls defeated, the Network was back online with advanced security measures in place. In a bid to rebuild its ranking in the world, Stark Industries announced the Starkdynamics event in Tokyo, an international think-tank comprising of a global consortium of brilliant people developing paradigm shifting concepts. While several companies showcased their work and research, Tony delivered a keynote speech announcing Project Epsilon, an effort that marked the procurement of Extremis, a carefully crafted virus which harnessed the bioelectrical potential to hack and upgrade the human repair center. Extremis offered the prospect of accelerated healing, boosted immune systems, and organ regeneration. Tony’s personal goal for the project was to heal himself of the shrapnel injuries he had sustained in Afghanistan that made him dependent upon his arc reactor technology. Harry Osborn - in a similar vein - saw the potential for Extremis to cure his inherited, terminal disease. Osborn approached the Avenger with the offer of collaboration. Despite tensions, the two came to an agreement and selected the best minds they knew to aid them in their research, the team making a breakthrough.

With newfound single-minded focus on his work, Tony discovered Oscorp files of questionable content, including connections to the Ravencroft Institute’s dabblings in human experimentation and schematics on patented Stark Industries technology. The discovery brought about a full breakdown of communication between the two CEOs as Tony began shutting Osborn out. In the following weeks, he staged a hackathon, hiring Yelena Belova to retrieve the Extremis sample from Oscorp’s Brooklyn lab. The young CEO’s health rapidly deteriorated with the strain of events, ushering in the Green Goblin who carried out several attacks against Stark Industries’ facilities, leaving almost a hundred casualties in their wake. During an attack at Avengers Mansion, the two clashed and Stark was left severely wounded, his arc reactor destroyed, and - if not for the assistance of Loki, who had his own grudges against the Goblin - left for dead.

Delivered to the Baxter Building and with Extremis administered, Tony learned the Goblin’s true identity. The two enhanced corporate moguls battled it out over Manhattan, ending in a destructive stalemate over the East River, both participants plunging into the depths below as lower Manhattan was thrown into darkness at the hands of an explosive EMP burst set off by the Goblin in one final act of vengeance. The faithful A.I., J.A.R.V.I.S., aided its creator at the conclusion of the dire situation, piloting the Iron Man suit to a safe location as New York City began to recover from the disastrous outcome of the brawl. The United Nations World Security Council resolved to take necessary action to counter the rising tide of an increasingly unaccountable enhanced vigilante community. With immense pressure placed upon S.H.I.E.L.D. to direct the momentum of such a measure, the Agreement Concerning Cooperation, Oversight and Registration of Discovered Superhumans (Accords) were soon subject to a first draft. Stark was the first Avenger to view it, and - in the aftermath of Extremis - became its first supporter based on his sheer guilt for the damage caused to the city, including of the death of one of S.H.I.E.L.D.’s young pilots.

While the Avengers met amongst themselves to discuss their course of action only to find themselves on opposite sides of a fence, Tony became increasingly involved in the support of the Accords. Stark Industries provided stringent protocols required for the database of registrants and Tony became the public face of registration. During a gesture of good will, the World Security Council offered a ceremonial signing of the Accords on S.H.I.E.L.D.‘s Iliad Helicarrier to Steve Rogers and Bucky Barnes. With inside string-pulling from HYDRA, the public was led to believe that the bureaucratic olive branch spiraled into a terrorist attack as the Helicarrier crashed into Liberty Island. Both Barnes and Rogers were implicated in the attack and forced underground. The event was enough to sway public opinion and registration became mandatory for all enhanced individuals, the billionaire tasked with finding the pair.

≡ CURRENTLY

As events unfolded, it was found that individuals detained at the Hart Island Facility were subjected to less than humane conditions and Tony’s opinion shifting to aid his fellow teammates during this desperate time. The Avengers disbanded shortly after the light shone on Hart Island unveiled its ugly truths. Tensions still strain high between the heroes as they aspire to return to their days of glory.

≡ NOTE

FightAsOne has Thor Odinson, Clint Barton, Carol Danvers, Bucky Barnes, and other various characters associated with Tony Stark.
